Function Documentation

static void CSL_rtcAlarmIntrClear ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcAlarmNum  alarmNum 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcAlarmIntrClear

Description
This function clears the ALARM interrupt status.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       alarmNum   The value identifies the alarm register for which the
                  Interrupts have to be enabled. 'alarmNum' can take one of
                  the following values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcAlarmNum

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_STS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcAlarmIntrClear(hRtc, alarmNum); // Clear the alarm interrupt
static void CSL_rtcAlarmIntrDisable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcAlarmNum  alarmNum 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcAlarmIntrDisable

Description
This function disables the ALARM interrupts.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       alarmNum   The value identifies the alarm register for which the
                  Interrupts have to be enabled. 'alarmNum' can take one of
                  the following values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcAlarmNum

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_INTRS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcAlarmIntrDisable(hRtc, alarmNum); // Disable the Alarm interrupt

inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcBcdToDec

Description
This API converts the input BCD number to its decimal equivalent number.

Arguments 

       bcdNum     The value that holds the number in BCD format.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Example 

     bdcToDec = CSL_rtcBcdToDec(hRtc); // Convert BDC to decimal

CSL_rtcClkSrc  clkSrc 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcClkSrcSelect

Description
This API selects the clock source for the RTC module.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       clkSrc     This specifies the RTC Clock source to be selected 'clkSrc'
                  can take one of the values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcClkSrc

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_OSC;

Example 

     CSL_rtcClkSrcSelect(hRtc, clkSrc); // Select the clock source
static void CSL_rtcCompensationEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enableCompensation 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcCompensationEnable

Description
This API is used to Enable/Disable Crystal Compensation feature to account for any inaccuracy in 32K oscillator.

Arguments 

       hRtc                The handle of the RTC module.
       enableCompensation  Value to specify enabling/disabling of the Test
                           Mode. 'enableCompensation' can take one of the
                           following values:
                             - TRUE to enable oscillator compensation feature
                             - FALSE to disable oscillator compensation feature

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_CTRL;

Example 

     CSL_rtcCompensationEnable(hRtc, enableCompensation); // Enable compensation

inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcDecToBcd

Description
This API converts the input decimal number to its BCD equivalent number.

Arguments 

       decNum   The value that holds the number in Hexadecimal format.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Example 

     decToBcd = CSL_rtcDecToBcd(hRtc); // Convert decimal to BCD
static void CSL_rtcEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enableModule 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcEnable

Description
This API enables/disables the RTC module.

Arguments 

       hRtc          The handle of the RTC module.
       enableModule  Value to indicate enabling/disabling of the module.
                     'enableModule' can take any of the two values:
                         - TRUE to enable the module.
                         - FALSE to disable the module.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_CTRL;
CSL_RTC_OSC;

Example 

     CSL_rtcEnable(hRtc, enableModule); // Enable/Disable the RTC module.
static void CSL_rtcFeedbackResistorSel ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcFeedbackResistor  resistorSel 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcFeedbackResistorSel

Description
This API selects the mode of the Oscillator Feedback resistor to either internal or external of the SOC.

Arguments 

       hRtc          The handle of the RTC module.
       resistorSel   This specifies whether the Oscillator Feedback resistor
                     to be used should be either external or internal to the
                     SoC. 'resistorSel' can take one of the following two
                     values from the following enum
                         - #CSL_rtcFeedbackResistor

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_OSC;

Example 

     CSL_rtcFeedbackResistorSel(hRtc, resistorSel);
                 // Select the mode of Oscillator Feedback resistor
static void CSL_rtcGetAlarm ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcAlarmNum  alarmNum,
CSL_rtcTimeObj *  pAlarmTime,
CSL_rtcDateObj *  pAlarmDate 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcGetAlarm

Description
This function reads the programmed Alarm information including Time and Date from the specified alarm register.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       alarmNum   The value identifies the alarm register for which the
                  Interrupts have to be enabled. 'alarmNum' can take one of
                  the following values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcAlarmNum
       pAlarmTime Pointer to the structure CSL_rtcTimeObj which contains the
                  variables representing Alarm Time to be set in the RTC.
       pAlarmDate Pointer to the structure CSL_rtcDateObj which contains the
                  variables representing Alarm Date to be set in the RTC.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_INTRS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcGetAlarm(hRtc, alarmNum, &alarmTime, &alarmDate); // Read alarm configuration

This function reads the compensation value being set in the compensation registers.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.

Return Value
None

None

None

Reads

CSL_RTC_COMP_MSB;

Example 

     CSL_rtcGetCompensationVal(hRtc); // Read compensation value
static void CSL_rtcGetDate ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcDateObj *  pDate 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcGetDate

Description
This function reads the calendar information from relevant registers holding date information.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       pDate      pointer to the structure CSL_rtcDateObj holding the variables
                  representing the Date through which the date set in the RTC
                  will be returned.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_YEARS;
CSL_RTC_MONTHS;
CSL_RTC_DAYS;
CSL_RTC_WEEKS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcGetDate(hRtc, &date); // Get current date
static Uint32 CSL_rtcGetRevision ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcGetRevision

Description
This function returns the revision Id of the module.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.

Return Value
The revision number of the RTC module. This will give the information regarding the major and minor revisions.

  • Bits[10:8] Major revision
  • Bits[7:6] Custom revision for a particular device
  • Bits[5:0] Minor revision

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_REVISION;

Example 

     CSL_rtcGetRevision(hRtc); // Read RTC revision

Uint32  regNum 
)

None

Example

static void CSL_rtcGetTime ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcTimeObj *  pTime 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcGetTime

Description
This function reads the current time from the registers holding time information.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       pTime      Pointer to the structure CSL_rtcTimeObj which contains the
                  variables representing the Time through which the time
                  set in the RTC will be returned.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_SECONDS;
CSL_RTC_MINUTES;
CSL_RTC_HOURS;
CSL_RTC_CTRL;
CSL_RTC_HOURS_PM_NAM;

Example 

     CSL_rtcGetTime(hRtc, &time); // Get current time
static Uint32 CSL_rtcIsBusy ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcIsBusy

Description
This function returns the status of RTC module.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.

Return Value
TRUE indicating RTC is busy updating an event.
FALSE indicating RTC event update is more than 15 seconds from the current time.

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_STS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcIsBusy(hRtc); // Enable the MMU

                         - #CSL_rtcExtWakeupSrc

None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_RTC_PMIC_REG;

static void CSL_rtcPmicExtWakeupPol ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcExtWakeupSrc  extWakeupSrc,
CSL_rtcWakeupEvtPol  wakeupEvtPol 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcPmicExtWakeupPol

Description
This API configures the Polarity of PMIC External Wakeup Pin

Arguments 

       hRtc          The handle of the RTC module.
       extWakeupSrc  The external Input pin to be configured. 'extWakeupSrc'
                     can take any of the values from the following enum
                         - #CSL_rtcExtWakeupSrc
       wakeupEvtPol  This specifies whether the PMIC External Wakeup.
                     Polarity to be low or high. 'wakeupEvtPol'
                     can take any of the values from the following enum
                         - #CSL_rtcWakeupEvtPol

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_RTC_PMIC_REG;

Example 

     CSL_rtcPmicExtWakeupPol(hRtc, extWakeupSrc, wakeupEvtPol);
                 // Configures the Polarity of PMIC External Wakeup Pin
static void CSL_rtcPmicPowerEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enablePmicPower 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcPmicPowerEnable

Description
This API controls the PMIC power enable signal which can be used to control an external PMIC.

Arguments 

       hRtc            The handle of the RTC module.
       enablePmicPower  This specifies whether the PMIC power enable signal
                        has to be pulled low or high. 'enablePmicPower'
                        can take any of the two values:
                             - TRUE to enable PMIC power enable signal
                             - FALSE to disable PMIC power enable signal

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_RTC_PMIC_REG;

Example 

     CSL_rtcPmicPowerEnable(hRtc, enablePmicPower);
                 // Control the PMIC power enable signal
static void CSL_rtcRoundingEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enableRounding 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcRoundingEnable

Description
This function Enables/Disables the feature of minute rounding.

Arguments 

       hRtc              The handle of the RTC module.
       enableRounding    value to specify whether the Rounding feature
                         has to be enabled/disabled. 'enableRounding' can
                         take any of the two values:
                             - TRUE to indicate enabling Rounding off feature
                             - FALSE to indicate disabling Rounding off feature

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_CTRL;

Example 

     CSL_rtcRoundingEnable(hRtc, enableRounding);
                 // Enable/Disable the minutes rounding

static void CSL_rtcSetAlarm ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcAlarmNum  alarmNum,
CSL_rtcTimeObj *  pAlarmTime,
CSL_rtcDateObj *  pAlarmDate 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcSetAlarm

Description
This function sets the specified alarm register with Alarm information including Time and Date.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       alarmNum   The value identifies the alarm register for which the
                  Interrupts have to be enabled. 'alarmNum' can take one of
                  the following values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcAlarmNum
       pAlarmTime Pointer to the structure CSL_rtcTimeObj which contains the
                  variables representing Alarm Time to be set in the RTC.
       pAlarmDate Pointer to the structure dateObj which contains the
                  variables representing Alarm Date to be set in the RTC.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_INTRS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcSetAlarm(hRtc, alarmNum, &alarmTime, &alarmDate); // Configure alarm
static void CSL_rtcSetCompensationVal ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Int32  compVal 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcSetCompensationVal

Description
This function sets the compensation registers with the specified drift compensation value versus one hour period of the oscillator frequency.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       compVal    The drift compensation value.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_COMP_LSB;
CSL_RTC_COMP_MSB;

Example 

     CSL_rtcSetCompensationVal(hRtc, compVal); // Set compensation value

static void CSL_rtcSetScratchPadVal ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcScratchPadReg  regNum,
Uint32  scratchVal 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcSetScratchPadVal

Description
This function writes the specified arbitrary value to the specified scratch register.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       regNum     Specifies the scratch register number to be accessed. This
                  can take the values from the following enum
                   - #CSL_rtcScratchPadReg
       scratchVal Refers to the value to be written to the scratch registers.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_SCRATCH0;

Example 

     CSL_rtcSetScratchPadVal(hRtc, regNum, scratchVal);
                 // Write given value to scratchpad register
static void CSL_rtcSetTime ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcTimeObj *  pTime 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcSetTime

Description
This function programs the specified time information in the Time registers.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       pTime      pointer to the structure CSL_rtcTimeObj which contains the
                  variables representing the Time to be set in the RTC.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_SECONDS;
CSL_RTC_MINUTES;
CSL_RTC_HOURS;
CSL_RTC_CTRL;
CSL_RTC_HOURS_PM_NAM;

Example 

     CSL_rtcSetTime(hRtc, &time); // Set current time

inlinestatic

Description
This function stops the RTC.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.

None

Post Condition
None

static void CSL_rtcTestModeEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enableTestMode 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcTestModeEnable

Description
This function is used to enable the MMU.

Arguments 

       hRtc           The handle of the RTC module.
       enableTestMode Value to specify enabling/disabling of the Test
                      Mode. 'enableTestMode' can take one of the following values:
                         - TRUE to enable a Test mode of the RTC
                         - FALSE to disable Test mode and switch back to functional mode.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_CTRL;

Example 

     CSL_rtcTestModeEnable(hRtc, enableTestMode); // Enable the test mode

static void CSL_rtcTimerIntrEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcTimerIntrMask  intrMask 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcTimerIntrEnable

Description
This function enables the periodic timer interrupt.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       intrMask   This specifies the period between two consecutive Timer
                  interrupts. 'intrMask' can take one of the following values
                  from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcTimerIntrMask

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_INTRS;

Example 

     CSL_rtcTimerIntrEnable(hRtc, intrMask); // Enable timer interrupt

static void CSL_rtcWakeupDisable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcWakeupEvtSrc  wakeupSrc 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcWakeupDisable

Description
This API controls the PMIC power enable signal which can be used to control an external PMIC.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       wakeupSrc  Value to specify the wakeup event source to disable
                  i.e. either the timer or the alarm based wakeup.
                  wakeupSrc' can take any of the values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcWakeupEvtSrc

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_IRQWAKEEN;

Example 

     CSL_rtcWakeupDisable(hRtc, wakeupSrc); // Disable the wakeup signal
static void CSL_rtcWakeupEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
CSL_rtcWakeupEvtSrc  wakeupSrc 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcWakeupEnable

Description
This API is used to Enable the Alarm and Timer event Wakeup signal to the CPU.

Arguments 

       hRtc       The handle of the RTC module.
       wakeupSrc  Value to specify the wakeup event source to disable
                  i.e. either the timer or the alarm based wakeup.
                  wakeupSrc' can take any of the values from the following enum
                     - #CSL_rtcWakeupEvtSrc

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_IRQWAKEEN;

Example 

     CSL_rtcWakeupEnable(hRtc, wakeupSrc); // Enable the wakeup signal
static void CSL_rtcWriteProtectEnable ( CSL_rtcHandle  hRtc,
Uint32  enableWriteProtect 
)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_rtcWriteProtectEnable

Description
This function enables/disables the write-protection for RTC registers.

Arguments 

       hRtc                The handle of the RTC module.
       enableWriteProtect  Value to specify whether write protection
                           feature has to be enabled/disabled.
                           'enableWriteProtect' can take any of the two values
                             - TRUE  to enable write protection the register
                                     are locked from spurious writes.
                             - FALSE to disable write protection to allow write
                                     access to RTC registers.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CSL_RTC_KICK0; CSL_RTC_KICK1;

Example 

     CSL_rtcWriteProtectEnable(hRtc, enableWriteProtect);
         // Enables/Disables the write-protection for RTC registers.
